page.title: 01In the Vale of York...
page.content: The area,0448 0459,is in the north-east of England and is about 209 miles from London. It lies east of the Pennines, in the Vale of York and North Yorkshire. Two villages {Linton-on-Ouse and Newton-on-Ouse} are nine and ten miles respectively north-west of York.Both villages are situated near the banks of the River Ouse,which is fairly slow moving and has a muddy bottom with sandy banks. South of the river lies Widdington, an agricultural area with several farms. The block lies between the A19 road on the east and the A1 on the west.The railway line from London to Edinburgh lies to the east.{ {Newton-on-Ouse Pop.in 1981-1,082. Area 939 hectares. {Newton-on-Ouse Pop.in 1981-359. Area 703 hectares. Mainly agricultural land
